results.title: In the shadow of the stars: the lives of singers
results.brief_description: Insightful documentary that goes beyond the glamour of the big names to look at the unsung heroes of the opera: the men and women who comprise the chorus. The singers of the San Francisco Opera speak frankly about their lives, aspirations and their music. Their stories are funny poignant and inspiring. The “behind the scenes” footage is fascinating and enhances the picture of what it means to work as a performing artist for a major company such as the San Francisco Opera.

results.title: In the shadow of the chimney
results.brief_description: In Melbourne’s densely populated Western suburbs huge chemical, petroleum and manufacturing plants have been built very close to residential areas. Apart from the visual pollution they cause, these plants emit toxic wastes. The level of emissions is loosely regulated and poorly monitored. This video examines the danger posed by these plants, and shows how grass-roots community action can be successful in making both government and industry accountable for the well-being of residents and the environment.

results.title: In the shadow of Hollywood [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sylvie Groulx, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: With its barrage of special effects, its new heroes and warrior myths, the American dream is not what it used to be. Aided by new trade strategies, Hollywood is tightening its stranglehold on the world’s screens, leaving no room for indigenous cultures. Disturbed by this one-sided war of images, the director consults filmmakers and other experts on both sides of the Atlantic. Agnieszka Holland, Arthur Penn, Alain Tanner, Bertrand Tavernier, Milos Forman and Denys Arcand ponder the fate of cinema in the era of globalization. Can auteur cinema with its personal vision, its expression of the collective identity, withstand the onslaught of American movies and their single-minded focus on entertainment? Includes interviews with Denys Arcand, Anne-Marie Bidaud, Luciana Castellina, Milos Forman, Claude Fournier, Agnieszka Holland, Marin Karmitz, Todd McCarthy, Jonathan Nossiter, Arthur Penn, Leslie Quinton, Roland Smith, Jean-Charles Tacchella, Alain Tanner, Bertrand Tavernier, Daniel Toscan du Plantier, Margarethe Von Trotta, Andrzej Wajda and Irwin Winkler. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: In the shadow of Djebel Sindjar
results.brief_description: Since Kurdistan is divided between Turkey, Iraq, Syria, Iran and Russia, a variety of lifestyles is evident throughout the country. This film tells of life in a tiny Yazidi village - Jedalla - in Kurdistan and compares this with life in a nomad camp.

results.title: In the service of peace
results.brief_description: Considers the work of the United Naitons in preserving peace throughout the world. Looks at various trouble-spots where UN forces are involved, particularly Cyprus. Here troops are maintaining surface peace and quiet between the Greeks and Turks. Highlights the training and activities of the Swedish contingent.

results.title: In the service of Europe
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of the Economic Council of Europe to every citizen of the 30 countries involved. It has stimulated and organised trade and promoted co-operation, through discussion, the interchange of ideas and assistance among the interdependent nations.

results.title: In the public interest
results.creator_credit: Colin Pym, Lindsay Parker, Victorian Film Corporation and S M S Audiovisual
results.brief_description: A film about the work of the Victorian Police and the various areas of involvement. Shown is the work of the Mounted Police in crowd control, the patrol cars, involvement in scenes of fires and burglaries, scientific investigation, the dog squad and boat patrol crews.

results.title: In the night kitchen
results.brief_description: With a musical score reminiscent of an old Laurel and Hardy movie, Maurice Sendak’s comic fantasy springs to life. Cake baking, bakers dancing and Mickey flying in his plane made of dough will delight children of all ages.

results.title: In the name of the father [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Gabriel Byrne and Hell's Kitchen
results.brief_description: Gerry Conlon, a petty crook in Belfast during the 1970’s, gets in trouble with the IRA. His father sends him to England where a twist of fate puts him in the wrong place at the wrong time when a pub in Guildford is bombed. Gerry and three of his friends, although innocent, are charged and convicted. Gerry’s father joins him in prison and despite years of a strained relationship, Gerry learns to regard his father’s gentle spirit as a strength. Enlisting the aid of a lawyer, Guiseppe Conlon is determined to prove his son’s innocence, and when he dies in prison, Gerry is determined to take up the cause. Evidence is discovered which implicates senior police officials in a massive cover-up, and the ‘Guildford Four’ are finally set free. Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite and Emma Thompson are brilliant in their roles.
